title: How to Do a Setting Test for Jam

steps.headline: Prepare the jam according to your given recipe.
steps.description: Follow the instructions to know the time by which the jam requires testing for setting.

steps.headline: Take a small portion of the jam that is cooking (use a wooden spoon).
steps.description: Place this portion onto a clean, cold saucer plate. Leave the jam to cool.

steps.headline: Wash your hands and dry them.
steps.description:
Using a clean, dry finger, draw a line through the middle of the jam on the saucer to create a "channel":
If the channel remains in place, the jam has set. If the jam oozes back inwards to rejoin the broken halves, more cooking time is needed.

text:
Prepare the jam according to your given recipe. Follow the instructions to know the time by which the jam requires testing for setting. Take a small portion of the jam that is cooking (use a wooden spoon). Place this portion onto a clean, cold saucer plate. Leave the jam to cool. Wash your hands and dry them. Using a clean, dry finger, draw a line through the middle of the jam on the saucer to create a "channel":
If the channel remains in place, the jam has set. If the jam oozes back inwards to rejoin the broken halves, more cooking time is needed.
